channel.title: Sed on Pat Browne
channel.description: Recent content in Sed on Pat Browne

item.title: Counting assembly instructions
item.description: As someone who may or may not procrastinate, I find myself shaving yaks occasionally. One such yak shave occurred recently while working on a project for my operating systems class. We were provided with an assembly file written in x86 GNU assembly syntax. I wondered if the file contained any instructions I wasn’t familiar with or hadn’t used in awhile. My first task was to figure out all of these unique assembly instructions, look them up in the Intel manual, and use them (plus 1-2 others) for the code I was going to write.
